mixins.description: Mixin that provides web-color-properties. Its `color-string` converts automatically beetween different formats (hex, rgb and hsl) and provides an alpha-colorString.

properties.name: hex
properties.description: Hex-color

properties.name: r
properties.description: Red

properties.name: g
properties.description: Green

properties.name: b
properties.description: Blue

properties.name: h
properties.description: Hue

properties.name: s
properties.description: Saturation (hsl)

properties.name: l
properties.description: Lightness

properties.name: alpha
properties.description: Alpha

properties.name: alphaMode
properties.description: if true, colorString has alpha

properties.name: hslPrecision
properties.description: Precision of hsl-colorStrings, if the format is 'hsl' (for saturation and lightness it is applied according to their percentage colorString)

properties.name: format
properties.description: format of the colorString (possible colorStrings: 'rgb', 'hex', 'hsl', 'auto')

properties.name: colorString
properties.description: hex-color

mixins.name: ColorMixin

attributes.name: hex
attributes.description: Hex-color

attributes.name: r
attributes.description: Red

attributes.name: g
attributes.description: Green

attributes.name: b
attributes.description: Blue

attributes.name: h
attributes.description: Hue

attributes.name: s
attributes.description: Saturation (hsl)

attributes.name: l
attributes.description: Lightness

attributes.name: alpha
attributes.description: Alpha

attributes.name: alpha-mode
attributes.description: if true, colorString has alpha

attributes.name: hsl-precision
attributes.description: Precision of hsl-colorStrings, if the format is 'hsl' (for saturation and lightness it is applied according to their percentage colorString)

attributes.name: format
attributes.description: format of the colorString (possible colorStrings: 'rgb', 'hex', 'hsl', 'auto')

attributes.name: color-string
attributes.description: hex-color

mixins.description: Mixin that provides intl-format-locale for datetime and computes some separation strings for usage.

properties.name: locale
properties.description: The current locale

properties.name: decimalSeparator
properties.description: locale separator for local decimal values

properties.name: dateSeparator
properties.description: Separator for local date values (date-string is still in ISO-Format)

properties.name: timeSeparator
properties.description: Separator for local time values (time-string is still in ISO-Format)

properties.name: amString
properties.description: locale representation of 'AM'

properties.name: pmString
properties.description: locale representation of 'PM'

mixins.name: IntlDatetimeFormatMixin

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The current locale

attributes.name: decimal-separator
attributes.description: locale separator for local decimal values

attributes.name: date-separator
attributes.description: Separator for local date values (date-string is still in ISO-Format)

attributes.name: time-separator
attributes.description: Separator for local time values (time-string is still in ISO-Format)

attributes.name: am-string
attributes.description: locale representation of 'AM'

attributes.name: pm-string
attributes.description: locale representation of 'PM'

properties.name: locale
properties.description: The current locale

properties.name: decimalSeparator
properties.description: locale separator for local decimal values

properties.name: dateSeparator
properties.description: Separator for local date values (date-string is still in ISO-Format)

properties.name: timeSeparator
properties.description: Separator for local time values (time-string is still in ISO-Format)

properties.name: amString
properties.description: locale representation of 'AM'

properties.name: pmString
properties.description: locale representation of 'PM'

properties.name: year
properties.description: The year of the selected date

properties.name: month
properties.description: The month of the selected date (starts with 1)

properties.name: day
properties.description: The day of the selected date

properties.name: hour
properties.description: The hour of the selected time

properties.name: hour12
properties.description: hour in 12-hour-format

properties.name: isAm
properties.description: true, when A.M. (when `hour` < 12)

properties.name: minute
properties.description: The minute of the selected time

properties.name: second
properties.description: The second of the selected time

properties.name: millisecond
properties.description: The millisecond of the selected time

properties.name: datetime
properties.description: the selected date and time (format: iso8601)

properties.name: date
properties.description: the selected date (format: iso8601)

properties.name: time
properties.description: the selected time (format: iso8601)

properties.name: valueAsDate
properties.description: The date-object of the selected date

properties.name: valueAsNumber
properties.description: The value of the selected date

properties.name: default
properties.description: The default value of the input, could be a number, a date-object or an iso-string in time, date or datetime-notation

properties.name: min
properties.description: The minimal date, could be a number, a date-object or an iso-string in time, date or datetime-notation

properties.name: max
properties.description: The maximal date, could be a number, a date-object or an iso-string in time, date or datetime-notation

properties.name: hour12Format
properties.description: when true, 12-hour time format, else 24-hour

properties.name: clamp
properties.description:
Clamp datetime to a property
possible values:'month', 'day', 'hour', 'minute', 'second', 'millisecond'

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: The timezone offset in '±hh:mm' format

properties.name: _timezoneOffset
properties.description: The offset minute of the set timezone

properties.name: _recentLocalTimezoneOffset
properties.description: The offset minute of the current datetime

properties.name: _maxDayOfMonth
properties.description: exclusive max day of month

properties.name: _regexpDatetime
properties.description: Regular Expression for datetime-string

properties.name: _regexpTimezone
properties.description: Regular Expression for datetime-string

properties.name: _dateLocked
properties.description: lock to date and ignore time

properties.name: _timeOnly
properties.description: perspective starts at 0 (1970-01-01)

properties.name: dateOrder
properties.description: order of date-parts

methods.name: now
methods.description: Sets value to the actual date

methods.name: _setDate
methods.description: sets date to all necessary properties

methods.name: _hour12Changed
methods.description: `hour12` is the hour in hour12-format, that starts is minimal 1 and maximal 12, midnight is at 12am and noon is 12pm

mixins.description: Mixin that extends duration properties of a time period to an element.

properties.name: start
properties.description: start of the time period

properties.name: end
properties.description: end of the time period

properties.name: valueAsString
properties.description: string representation of the time period

properties.name: valueAsNumber
properties.description: value of the time period in milliseconds

properties.name: _regExpValueString
properties.description: RegExp of a valueString

mixins.name: DurationMixin

attributes.name: start
attributes.description: start of the time period

attributes.name: end
attributes.description: end of the time period

attributes.name: value-as-string
attributes.description: string representation of the time period

attributes.name: value-as-number
attributes.description: value of the time period in milliseconds

mixins.description: mixin to provide a range behavior for a given value

properties.name: min
properties.description: minimal input

properties.name: max
properties.description: maximal input

properties.name: step
properties.description: step for changing the input (referencing to `min` or `0`)

properties.name: stepMod
properties.description:
a step modifier. this is useful if you are having one step for multible elements that represent parts of numbers, like when you are having one input for the decimal part and one for the integer part.
For example:
  * if `step` is `0.002` and the `step-mod` is `1000`, `2` will be used
  * if `step` is `10` and the `step-mod` is `0.02`, `0.2` will be used

properties.name: _step
properties.description: the used step, product of stepMod and step

properties.name: valueAsNumber
properties.description: value of the input

properties.name: default
properties.description: default-value of the input

properties.name: saturate
properties.description: if true, the value does not revolve the range according to the maximum or the minimum

properties.name: noClamp
properties.description: if true, the value does not clamp according to the given step

methods.name: _safeMult
methods.description: emulating handwritten multiplication to keep precision

methods.name: _safeAdd
methods.description: emulating handwritten addition to keep precision

mixins.name: RangeMixin

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: minimal input

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: maximal input

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: step for changing the input (referencing to `min` or `0`)

attributes.name: step-mod
attributes.description:
a step modifier. this is useful if you are having one step for multible elements that represent parts of numbers, like when you are having one input for the decimal part and one for the integer part.
For example:
  * if `step` is `0.002` and the `step-mod` is `1000`, `2` will be used
  * if `step` is `10` and the `step-mod` is `0.02`, `0.2` will be used

attributes.name: value-as-number
attributes.description: value of the input

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: default-value of the input

attributes.name: saturate
attributes.description: if true, the value does not revolve the range according to the maximum or the minimum

attributes.name: no-clamp
attributes.description: if true, the value does not clamp according to the given step

mixins.description: Mixin that provides intl-format-locale for numbers and computes some separation strings for usage (only `latn`-numeral-system is possible).

properties.name: locale
properties.description: The current locale

properties.name: decimalSeparator
properties.description: locale separator for local decimal values

properties.name: groupingSeparator
properties.description: locale separator for grouping decimal values

properties.name: minimumFractionDigits
properties.description: The minimum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number and percent formatting is 0; the default for currency formatting is the number of minor unit digits provided by the ISO 4217 currency code list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information).

properties.name: maximumFractionDigits
properties.description: The maximum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and 3; the default for currency formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and the number of minor unit digits provided by the ISO 4217 currency code list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information); the default for percent formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and 0.

properties.name: minimumIntegerDigits
properties.description: The minimum number of integer digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 1.

properties.name: minimumSignificantDigits
properties.description: The minimum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 1.

properties.name: maximumSignificantDigits
properties.description: The maximum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is minimumSignificantDigits.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: unit of the output (only used when `number-style="decimal"`)

properties.name: unitSeparator
properties.description: the separator to separate value and unit

properties.name: alwaysSign
properties.description: always put the sign at the beginning

properties.name: numberStyle
properties.description:
The formatting style to use. Possible values are "decimal" for plain number formatting, "currency" for currency formatting, and "percent" for percent formatting; the default is "decimal".
notice: min, max and step are not in percent (so e.g. if step is 0.01, it means that the step is 1%)

properties.name: useGrouping
properties.description: if true the number will be grouped according to the locale.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: The currency to use in currency formatting. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as "USD" for the US dollar, "EUR" for the euro, or "CNY" for the Chinese RMB — see http://www.currency-iso.org/en/home/tables/table-a1.html. There is no default value; if the style is "currency", the currency property must be provided.

properties.name: currencyDisplay
properties.description: How to display the currency in currency formatting. Possible values are "symbol" to use a localized currency symbol such as €, "code" to use the ISO currency code, "name" to use a localized currency name such as "dollar"; the default is "symbol".

properties.name: _numberOptions
properties.description: number format options

properties.name: formatNumber
properties.description: number format function

properties.name: parseNumber
properties.description: function to parse the input

properties.name: _regExpNotInNumber
properties.description: Regular Expression for non numeric signs

mixins.name: IntlNumberFormatMixin
